p: Several species are also weedy and thus provide both benefits and costs in their native ranges ( P. affinis, P. caldenia, P. campestris, P. chilensis, P. cineraria, P. farcta, P. glandulosa, P. hassleri, P. humilis, P. juliflora, P. kuntzei, P. nigra, P. pubescens, P. ruscifolia, P. strombulifera, P. tamarugo, P. velutina) [see Supporting Information] . At least 19 (invasive and weedy) of the 44 species in the genus are known to generate benefits and costs, with the rest being only beneficial. The invasiveness and potential negative impacts of many Prosopis species are still unknown as only a handful have been introduced.
